title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.34 | 02-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshthaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Devim Saraswateem Vyasam Tatham
Jaya Mudhi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 34th verse of the 9th chapter of the 1st canto of Shreemad Bhagavatam.
Yudhi Turaga Rajo Vidhumra Vishvak
Kachalulita Shramavarya Lankratasye
Mama Nishita Sharair Vibhidhyamana
Tvachi Vilasat Kavachestu Krishna Aatma
The meaning of this verse is
On the battlefield where Shri Krishna attended Arjuna out of friendship, the flowing hair of Lord Krishna turned ashen due to the dust raised by the hooves of the horses.
And because of his labour, beads of sweat wetted his face.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
All these decorations intensified by the wounds dealt by my sharp arrows.
Bhishma Deva, he is fixing his mind on Shri Krishna by remembering the different transcendental
forms of the Lord on the battlefield of Kurukshetra, Bhishma as has been explained earlier is situated
in a transcendental relationship called Virya Rasa with Lord Shri Krishna, so Krishna enjoys
that fighting with Bhishma and in the battlefield of Kurukshetra Krishna is not fighting Arjuna
is fighting.
So Bhishma
is attacking Arjuna as the enemy but Krishna is trying to protect Arjuna. So, Bhishma is
releasing arrows to kill Arjuna but Krishna is intercepting those arrows and those arrows are
striking Krishna's transcendental body. Now, the transcendental body as will be explained by
Srila Prabhupada cannot be wounded, cannot be destroyed, cannot be cut. It is completely
spiritual. So, that is the difficult part to understand for a common man. Therefore, we have
to hear such descriptions from the lips of a pure devotee who will explain perfectly how to
understand these dealings between the lord and his devotees.
So, Srila Prabhupada explains elaborately in this purport. The lord is the absolute form of
eternity, bliss and knowledge. Eternity, his body, his form, his existence is eternal. Sat, chit,
knowledge, full of knowledge, ananda, full of bliss. As such, transcendental loving service to
the lord in one of the five principles.
Namely, shanta, dasya, sakya, vatsalya and madhurya. That is neutrality,
servitorship, fraternity, filial affection and conjugal love is graciously accepted by the lord
when offered to the lord in genuine love and affection. Everyone has a specific relationship
with Krishna, every living being. So, the perfection of our life is to,
reinstate ourselves in that relationship with Krishna loving relationship with Krishna
in one of the five primary relationships
so Sri Bhishma Deva is a great devotee of the lord in the relation of servitorship
there are secondary rasas and primary rasas primary rasas are based on the primary relationship
and while exchanging this rasa with the supreme lord
there are secondary rasas also in the course of exchange of the primary rasa
that is what gives rise to variety of the rasas exchanged in the activities of that relationship
so Bhishma is situated primarily in the relationship of dasya as a servant as a servitor
thus his throwing of sharp arrows at the transcendental body of the lord
is as good as the worship of another devotee who throws soft roses upon him
so how is Krishna receiving these arrows shot by Bhishma
Krishna is receiving it exactly like another devotee offers soft roses while worshipping the lord
for Krishna both are same there is no difference
why because Bhishma is a devotee
it appears that Bhishma Deva is repenting the actions he committed against the person of the lord
the way Bhishma is describing here in his prayers
it appears like he is repenting
why did I shoot arrows at the supreme lord
or why did my arrows which are meant for striking Arjuna go and hit Krishna my worshipable lord
but factually the lord's body was not at all pained
due to his actions
this is a transcendental existence
this we understand from the Bhagavad Gita
spirit or spiritual form
transcendental form
is of a different quality than material form
we know this material body is subject to being wounded
when somebody shoots an arrow
at my body
then my body can become wounded
but Krishna's form or body is not material
his body is not matter
both he himself and his body are complete spiritual identity
spiritual it is spiritual
and Krishna has his identity as the supreme lord
this material body is not our identity
I appear like a human being
because I have got a human like material body
but actually I am not this body
neither my identity is a human being
this is in this life
my mind and body system works like a human beings
mind and body
in another life
if I have the body of a Devata
then I will act and behave like a Devata
if some other living being has got the body of a dog
then the living being in that dog's body will behave and act like a dog
but we are neither dog
nor we are human
nor we are Devata
we are eternally
devotee of Krishna
in the spiritual form
so that form
spiritual form
is not having an identity
based on this material coverings
this is not our identity
so Krishna's identity is he is the supreme lord
and he is the supreme lord
in a spiritual form as Krishna
spirit is never pierced, burnt, dried, moistened etc
spirit cannot be destroyed by anything
by any of the elements
by fire
by water
by air
by wind
by some weapon
material weapon made of one of the elements
like metal or any of those elements
it cannot be destroyed
this is vividly explained in the Bhagavad Gita
chapter
verses 11 to 30
clearly it is explained
so also it is stated in the Skanda Purana
this confirmed in the Skanda Purana also
spiritual form cannot be
destroyed by any weapon
it is said there that spirit is always uncontaminated and indestructible
spirit is never contaminated by matter
even in our case
even though there is a material covering for our original spiritual form
still that spiritual form or spirit cannot be contaminated by matter
this remains like a superficial covering only
and it cannot be destroyed
spiritual form cannot be destroyed
it is eternal form
it cannot be distressed
nor it can be dried up
it cannot be distressed
the spiritual form
there is no question of distress
when lord Vishnu in his incarnation appears before us
he seems to be like one of the conditioned souls
materially encaged
encaged means material
body has trapped
us in this body
or we have become
imprisoned in this body
but that imprisonment is
at the level of consciousness
because the spirit soul is not a physical
entity
so imprisonment here means
I am conditioned
now Vishnu appears
to be like
one of the conditioned souls
just to bewilder the asuras
or the non-believers
who are always alert to kill the lord
even from the very beginning of his appearance
the asuras or the demons
they are always envious of Krishna
and
because they are envious of Krishna
when Krishna appears
they want to kill him
Kamsa wanted to kill Krishna
and Ravana wanted to kill Rama
you have heard this from the scriptures
because foolishly they were unaware of the fact
that the lord is never killed
for the spirit is never annihilated
lord is completely spiritual
so how can he be killed
by anybody
by any weapon
not possible
therefore
Bhishma's piercing of the body of lord Krishna
is a sort of bewildering problem
for the non-devotee atheist
the non-devotees hear this
they will ridicule
you consider Krishna as god
but how is Bhishma able to pierce
his body
by shooting sharp arrows
so non-devotees cannot understand
but
those who are devotees
or liberated souls
are not bewildered by this
description
they are not bewildered by this description
nothing happens to Krishna
as far as his
transcendental form is concerned
it cannot be
affected by any of the weapons
Bhishma Deva appreciated the all-merciful attitude of the lord
because he did not leave Arjuna
alone
although he was disturbed by the sharpened arrows of Bhishma Deva
nor was he reluctant to come before Bhishma's deathbed
even though he was ill-treated by Bhishma on the battlefield
see Krishna is so kind to his devotees
he understands the devotees mood
of serving
and therefore he
did not mind the sharpened arrows of Bhishma
when Bhishma was fighting on the battlefield
nor did he
become reluctant to come in front of Bhishma
when Bhishma was about to quit his body
so therefore Bhishma's relationship with the lord
is one of pure devotion
and that is to be understood
in this exchange
between Bhishma and the supreme lord
I will stop here
thank you very much
Hare Krishna
